problem_text:
Context:
After the Turkish disaster at Vienna in September 1683, Austria and Poland formed an alliance to push the Turks south ). In 1686 Russia joined in ). After the Turks were pushed out of Hungary in 1687 fighting was inconclusive. In the Crimean campaigns of 1687 and 1689 the Russians failed in an attempt to invade Crimea. In 1695 Russia tried to take some forts on the lower Dnieper. By the treaties of 1699/1700 Turkey lost Hungary to Austria, Podolia to Poland and Azov, temporarily, to Russia.

Question:
Which countries did the first two members of the alliance gain access to after the treaties of 1699/1700?
question_alone: Which countries did the first two members of the alliance gain access to after the treaties of 1699/1700?

steps.step_response:
Sure, I will break down the problem into smaller parts:

1. Which countries formed an alliance after the Turkish disaster at Vienna in September 1683?
2. Which country joined the alliance in 1686?
3. What was the outcome of the fighting after the Turks were pushed out of Hungary in 1687?
4. What happened in the Crimean campaigns of 1687 and 1689?
5. What did Russia try to do in 1695?
6. What did Turkey lose to Austria, Poland, and Russia in the treaties of 1699/1700?
7. Which countries did the first two members of the alliance gain access to after the treaties of 1699/1700?
